evidences.text: It's our analytical thinking. So today I'm going to talk about what is known as graphs.
A graph has a set of vertices usually represented by a little circle.
And it has what is known as edges.
So this graph here has three vertices and two edges.
So a graph like this is denoted usually by G as graphic graph.
And we say that's equal to a set of vertices.
So the set V in this example is 1, 2, 3 and it has the same set of edges.
Each edge is a pair of vertices.
Or I can write this equation to represent the graph.
Any of these representations should give you complete information about what the graph is.
I usually just do this because it's much easier to communicate a picture than a paragraph in English or a description of this type typically.
We'll also talk about how many edges a graph could have.
And the other extreme, you have graphs with lots of edges.
